snippet: Only a small percentage of horse meat was found in products labeled as beef, but only a quarter of those products have been tested.
abstract: Britain's food safety agency, battling to contain mounting crisis over horse meat in products labeled as beef, says more than 2,500 tests conducted by food industry had shown that just 29 samples contained more than 1 percent horse meat; only about 25 percent of beef products have been tested, and each day more are being withdrawn from supermarkets, restaurants and schools.
lead_paragraph: Only a small percentage of horse meat was found in products labeled as beef, but only a quarter of those products have been tested.

headline.main: Furor Over Use of Horse Meat Grows in Britain Despite Testing
headline.print_headline: Furor Over Use of Horse Meat Grows in Britain Despite Testing
